But he didn't give up & still kept trying to keep in contact because he loved & then helped her out of her depression. Hopefully during that second time skip she told him everything & he decided to stay with her. But if not fuck her & she'll 100% cheat again. Keep the wholesome stuff out of netorare its out of place & if it is in there the cheater needs to be reprimanded then give a happy ending.

I really like this story.  It tells of 2 women who make bad choices, realize their mistakes and have happy endings.  The daughter, Aoi, gets turned on while drunkenly making out thinking it's with her boyfriend, and she falls easily, breaks up with childhood friend, Konishi, and then gets dumped. In Japan, a messy apt. is always a sign of mental issues. Here, she's not just upset about breaking up, but she understands how badly she fucked up. She's rescued by Konishi, and she realizes she has a 2nd chance and she's determined not to blow it. Mom Kumiko is bored, the center of her life is gone off, and she starts the affair because of her boredom. But when she sees the disaster Aoi got into, with am unknowing push from her husband, she breaks things off, deciding what's most important to her, and she successfully works to rekindle things with her husband.  Both women are rewarded for making the right choices and live happily ever after. This story has a believable, real life feel to it.

Side note, i find it interesting that the people who are rooting for the ntr in general always have a very similar opinion and criticism. 
It's always "vanilla fags lol go cry about it somewhere else, why you reading this then" or something. Usually quite disdainful and directed towards other people in order to make them feel bad or angry, while the opposing "vanilla enthusiasts" are usually just complaining about the story itself or the genre itself, rarely ever directed towards anyone in particular. My conclusion from observation? Almost EVERYONE that's actively defending or rooting for the ntr genre all seems to be a bit of a jerk/douchebag/asshole to some degree towards other people, while the opposing "vanilla enthusiasts" are just people that are voicing their opinion. 
Plus, if youre actually advocating for the idea of cheating and hurting others, you sjpuld probably sit down and think for a while - "Am i just a horrible person?" (You probably are.)

You're all deluded if you think this is in any way a happy ending. 
Both the mother and daughter is INCREDIBLY selfish, as evident in how the daughter just keeps going on about her own "ideal uni life" but once she cheats she seems to be quite eagerly fucking the other guy, seemingly ignoring her boyfriend. 
And not once did she apologize or admit to the cheating, and just accepts the glasses guy's kindness when he offers it. 
The mother too, just straight up cheats but nothing happens on her end, and she acts as if it never happened and moves on with her life. That mother IS that daughter's future if she marries glasses guy. 
Both mother and daughter WILL cheat and fuck around if given the opportunity, and will NOT feel bad about it. The blond guy said it best. She treats her loved ones like a tool for her own pleasure.

Y'know, I dunno why, but this reminds me of a joke. It goes (more or less) like this: 
"A kid is struggling with his homework, and goes to his father for help. He asks him 'Dad, what's the difference about the expressions 'in theory' and 'in practice'?' His father answers 'Well son, ask your mother if she would fuck the neighbour for a million dollars.' The son goes and returns with the answer: 'She said she would.' The father tells him 'Now ask the same thing to your sister.' The kid goes and returns with the same answer: 'She said she would.' The father tells him 'Now ask the same thing to your older brother.' And the kid returns once again with the same answer: 'He said he would.' The father then says 'And there you have it. In theory, we got three million dollars, but in practice, what we got are two whores and a faggot.'"

@glad1985 I disagree with pretty much everything you said. We don't know how she felt about the blonde guy or how committed she was. We don't even see them doing anything but have sex. We know she felt like shit for being dumped, but we don't know what happened in those "1 year later" timeskips. Hell, we don't even know if she broke up with the glasses guy. She could've cucked him for a year for all we know. It would be nice if we saw them struggling to build their relationship back like you said, but we don't see that or anything that even suggests that, not even an apology. This story tries to be realistic but fails on many fronts. Real life doesn't just let you off the hook like this. I've made mistakes as a 19-year-old, but I faced consequences for them. @banbanner > she tried to "manipulate" glasses mc to love her by acting demanding of sex How? When? At the beginning he wanted to do it, but she was on her period. There was no manipulation. The second scene happens a year after he helps her and it's clearly implied that they are already in a new relationship and they are just more open about their needs. And yes, of course her reconciliation with glasses was after the other guy dumped her, because it's implied she was committed to him for that time. IMHO it's because of that year she was with the other guy, that her redemption is possible - to her it was not a fling. It was a serious relationship she made a commitment to. It might have been due to regret of cheating and not wanting all of it to be for nothing, but she still stuck with it and from my perspective that's a positive trait. Where are you seeing tears of happiness? Her face looks like her soul is dead, even when she smiles in middle panel p29.

@banbanner it's not about justifying, it's about understanding the concept of the story and decisions made by characters. It was obviously a serious issue, hence it took them within a year to get back together. And, again, you are acting like a girl in the middle of all of that would have enough introspection and experience to fully objectively look at the whole situation and figure out that her boyfriend, that surely within that year was whispering her sweet nothings all the time, is actually a bad influence and a manipulator. People way older than her are stuck in abusive and unhealthy relationships all over the place. Especially when she likely wanted to believe in him, because otherwise what she did would seem even worse. At the end, she is probably stuck in bed because she both, lost him and was ultimately crushed by guilt and regret of what she did for what ended up being just a fake.

@banbanner you are way too cynical - sure, that line of thinking works in your generic ntr, but it's obvious here author is trying to write a bit more real story, no reason to mock it. The mistake was cheating and picking the wrong person. She was serious about the relationship with the other guy too, hence being with him for a year after breaking up with glasses and breaking down when he left her. She tears up, because after what happened she finally sees that the other guy was only in it for her body, while the glasses is there for her regardless of anything else and with no expectation of anything - he is a good friend first. Then there is another time skip, because they didn't just jump back into the relationship, but they rebuild it in that time. You guys are way too harsh on a kid making a mistake, acting like it's irredeemable and people can't change based on their action. People are really dumb, usually up to at least their late 20s. Fucking up while around 19 is fairly normal.

The guilt and regret is implied in the scene where she breaks down (p29), it doesn't have to be written. And glasses guy obviously figured out she cheated on page 24. He came back anyway with full knowledge of what happened. It's rare to see a cheating hentai written in the context of "people making mistakes", and reflecting/changing based on them - that's more on a daughter's part though, I can't really empathize with mother, since she should have known better. At the same time, for her it was seemingly a 1-time thing, where she cut it off immediately vs. her daughter getting into relationship with a guy for a year. p25-26 is the real ending of most ntr stories. A year is already a lot for those kinds of guys. 3-6 months would probably be more realistic, unless they just drop by to fuck from time to time, but that's not what's implied here.

This is a good one for plot because it leaves both options as a potential without enough to know which is ultimately true leaving it to us.
